question5_key1: Ek number ka factorial 1 se leke uss number tak ke saare numbers ko ek saath multiply karke nikalta hai.
question5_key2: Jaise 3 ka factorial 6 hai. Kyunki `1 * 2 * 3` ko calculate karke 6 aata hai
question5_key3: 4 ka factorial 24 hai. Kyunki `1 * 2 * 3 * 4` ko calculate karke 24 aata hai
question5_key4: Aise hi 7 ka factorial 5040 hai. Kyunki `1 * 2 * 3 * 4 * 5 * 6 * 7` ko calculate karke 5040 aata hai
question5_key5: Ab aap ek program likhoge jo ki user se ek `integer` `input` lega aur fir uska factorial print karega. Agar user `3` dalega to `6` print karega, `7` dalega toh `5040` print karega aur aise hi dusre numbers ke lie.
question5_key6: *Note: Abhi ke liye yeh soch lo ki user sirf positive `integers` hi dalega. Negative `integers` kabhi nahi dalega.*
